  • #Covid19 : L’état de la connexion Internet en Tunisie

    Suite à la propagation rapide du nouveau virus #Covid19 qui a attaqué la Tunisie depuis le 2 Mars 2020, le gouvernement tunisien a décidé d'appliquer des mesures préventives afin de limiter la propagation de ce virus en appliquant un confinement général sur tout le territoire tunisien à partir du Dimanche 22 Mars 2020.

    Suite à ce confinement général, tout le monde est amené à rester chez soi et de ne pas sortir que pour des besoins urgents ce qui a explosé le besoin en bande passante et a causé une saturation du réseau national d'internet. Et malheureusement, la majorité des sites préférés des tunisiens ne sont pas hébergés dans des Datacenters en Tunisie.

    Selon des statistiques du Tunixp, les tunisiens ont consommé 120 Gb/s en Mars 2019 et cette demande a augmenté d'une façon exponentielle ce mois , Mars 2020, pour atteindre un pique de 372 Gb/s. Une augmentation de 310 % !

    [caption id="attachment_4861" align="aligncenter" width="567"] Bande passante 03-2019[/caption]

    [caption id="attachment_4860" align="aligncenter" width="567"] Bande passante 03-2020[/caption]

    Tunisie Telecom , l'opérateur tunisien, a décidé donc d'augmenter sa bande passante internationale à environ 350 Gb/s (source: THD). Mais cette décision ne résoudra pas le problème parce que la Tunisie ne dispose pas malheureusement de contenu hébergé localement sur le territoire tunisien donc la majorité des sites web visités, contenus multimédia regardés par les tunisiens doivent être passés à l'internationale ce qui sature davantage la bande passante internationale limitée qu'on dispose.

    Même après l’augmentation de la bande passante, le ministre des Technologies de la communication et de la transition digitale a publié aujourd'hui un communiqué, sur sa page Facebook, demandant aux internautes de limiter l’accès aux sites de Streaming et des jeux vidéos en ligne a partir de 09:00 jusqu’à 18:00 pour économiser la bande passante afin d'assurer une qualité minimale pour les personnes qui font du télétravail. Personnellement je vois que le ministère des TIC a dû en premier lieu publier son communiqué sur son site web (qui est hébergé en Tunisie) au lieu de le publier sur sa page Facebook seulement. On parle de la bande passante internationale !

    Le virus Corona, Covid19, a changé radicalement le comportement des Tunisiens et les a encouragé à essayer plusieurs solutions en ligne comme les sites de e-commerce, télétravail ... Certainement plusieurs Start-up vont opter pour des services en ligne à partir de maintenant, tout en espérant que l'administration tunisienne aussi change les procédures en papier. J’espère voir une Administration 2.0 après Corona.

    #StayHome

    Que Dieu protège notre pays !

  • Nutzen Keine FB App, weder FB Messenger : Meine Erfahrung

    Heutzutage, Facebook ist überall: unsere Handy, unsere Tablett, unsere Computer usw ... Facebook, diese riesige Firma, weißt alles über uns: Wo leben wir, Wo waren wir gestern, Wer sind unsere Freunden, und so viel andere Informationen dass auch unsere Familie weißt nicht über uns !

    Leider, fast jeder Mensch nutzt Facebook und könnte auf kein Fall ohne es leben.

    Deshalb möchte ich diese Beitrag mit euch teilen weil möchte euch erzählen über meine Erfahrung: Wie lebe ich ohne FB Anwendungen ? Wie kann ich mit meine Freunden verbinden ?

    Was ist ein soziales Netzwerk eigentlich ?

    Laut Wikipedia:

    Ein soziales Netzwerk ist ein Onlinedienst, der die Möglichkeit zu Informationsaustausch und Beziehungsaufbau bietet.

    Heutzutage, Facebook hast über 2,27 Milliarden monatlich aktive Nutzer. Aber was machen alle diese Nutzer auf Facebook ? Warum nutzen sie Facebook jeden Tag ?

    Warum nutzen wir Facebook ? Was ist das Problem ?

    Mit sozialen Netzwerk können Menschen ihre Favoriten gemeinsam teilen und ihre Freundin und Familie erreichen. Sie können auch Neuigkeiten von der ganzen Welt folgen.

    Aber das Problem hier ist dass Facebook unserer privat Daten speichern und versucht immer unserer Nutzungszeit zu aufsteigen. Warum ? Weil es willst einfach mehr Informationen über uns sammeln um uns mehr personalisierter Werbung zu zeigen und dann mehr Geld verdienen.

    Mit der Anwendung kann Facebook viele Informationen über Sie sammeln z. B. :

    • Echt Beispiel 1: Anwendung Berechtigungen
      • SMS: Zugriff auf unsere SMS Nachrichten
      • Geräte- und App-Verlauf: Zugriff auf unsere laufenden Anwendungen (welche Anwendung verwenden wir gerade)
      • Geräte-ID & Anrufinformationen
      • Kamera
      • WLAN-Verbindungsinformationen
      • Mikrofon
      • Kalender: Zugriff auf unsere lokal Kalender
      • Kontakte: Zugriff auf unsere lokal Kontakte liste
      • Speicher: Zugriff auf alle unsere lokalen Daten (Fotos, Dokumente ...)
      • Identität
      • Standort: Zugriff auf unsere Ort
      • Telefon: Zugriff auf unsere Rufen Verlauf
      • Sonstiges:
        • Verbindung mit einem Bluetooth-Gerät herstellen
        • Zugriff auf den Akkustand

    Wie können Sie da oben sehen, erfordert die FB Anwendung Zugriff auf viele Berechtigungen von Ihrem Handy.

    • Echt Beispiel 2: Mikrofon zugriff ohne Benutzer Zustimmung

    Viele Menschen haben entdeckt, dass Facebook ihnen Werbung für Themen gezeigt hat, die sie mit ihrem Freund in einem Gespräch geredet hatten. Das heißt dass Facebook uns immer hören auch wenn wir die Anwendung nicht nutzen. Unsere Privatsphäre ist in Gefahr !

    Einmal ein Freund von mir hast mir gesagt dass er mit sein Freund über Baseball geredet hast und dann ein Tag nachher Facebook hast ihn ein Werbung über Baseball zeigt. Ich war sprachlos 😵

    Also was ist die Lösung eigentlich?

    Manch Leute glauben dass ihre leben ohne Facebook langweilig ist . Kurz Antwort: Falsch !

    Es gibt andere Möglichkeiten die wir nutzen können um unserer Freuden zu erreichen. Sie können zum Beispiel die Signal Anwendung nutzen. Diese Anwendung ist mit Ende-zu-Ende-Verschlüsselungsprotokoll sicher, das bedeutet : Signal hast auch niemals Zugriff auf Ihre Unterhaltung.

    Auch Wire bietet Sicherheit für sein Kunden. Es gibt viele andere Anwendung die Sie Nutzen können wie Telegram, Whatsapp ... Aber Achtung ! Die Anwendung muss auf jeden Fall Ende-zu-Ende-Verschlüsselungsprotokoll sicher.

    Fazit

    Unsere Ziel ist: Unsere Freunde zu schreiben, dann erreichen wir diese Ziel und sichern wir unsere privates gleichzeitig !

    Außerdem, bevor ein Anwendung installieren, lesen wir was es braucht (Daten, Berechtigungen, usw ...)

    Mehr Privatsphäre bedeutet mehr Freiheit.

  • Je mehr ich weiß, desto mehr weiß ich, dass ich nichts weiß.

    Sokrates einmal gesagt:

    "Je mehr ich weiß, desto mehr weiß ich, dass ich nichts weiß."

    Das ist ein ganz wichtige Zitate von Sokrates weil Niemand weiß alles, und die wissen habe keine Grenzen !

    Wann gestartet ich iOS Entwicklung lernen, ich geglaubte dass ich gehabt ein gute iOS Kenntnisse aber jetzt ich bin sicher dass ich war geirrt. Zum Beispiel, ich gelernte wie machen uitableview (delegate und datasource) aber es ist nicht genug. iOS hat fortgeschrittenere Funktionen als die !

    Wir müssen nicht sagen "genug" , wir müssen versuchen unser Kenntnisse verbessern jede Tag.

    Diese ist ein kurze Beitrag zu teilen mit dir diese Zitat von Sokrates weil ich glaube dass jeder muss folge es.

  • Announcement: PullUpToRefresh is here !

    This is a quick Blog post to annouce the new iOS library 'PullUpToRefresh' , written in Swift that add a pull from the bottom capability to UITableview.

    How to install it ?

    You could install it by adding this line to your Podfile :

    pod 'PullUpToRefresh'

    How to use it ?

    • Set your tableview custom Class to PullUpToRefreshTableview
    • Implement the PullUpToRefreshTableviewDelegate in your UIViewController

    Customization

      • bottomView : the view at the bottom that will be shown when refreshing

     

    • differenceThreshold : set how much you want to scroll in the bottom in order to show the bottom view
    • refreshThreshold : set how much you want to scroll in the bottom in order to start refreshing

    For more information about PullUpToRefresh, please visit PullUpToRefresh Github repository.

    If you have any questions or suggestions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

  • Wir sollten den plastikverbrauch jetzt begrenzen, oder ... Wir werden STERBEN !

    Jeden Tag werden Millionen von KG Plastik in die Natur geworfen: Wald, Ozean ...

    Wir sind die einzigen, die dafür verantwortlich sind, Millionen von Tieren zu töten, weil sie Plastik essen.

    Was verursacht dieses Problem ?

    Schnell antwort : Geld !

    Viele Firmen haben Plastik ausgewählt, weil es sehr billig ist. Sie verwenden es speziell für Verpackungen, die wir nur Minuten lang (generell) benötigen. Danach wird es in den Papierkorb gelegt und lässt die Natur jahrelang kämpfen...
    Tabelle der biologische Abbauzeit :

    • Papierhandtuch : 2-4 Wochen
    • Zeitung : 6 Wochen
    • Plastiktüten : 10-20 Jahre
    • Plastikflasche : 100 Jahre

    ⚠️ Minuten der Nutzung braucht jahrelange Reinigung !

    Wir sollten schnell handeln !

    • Vor allem , sollten wir den Plastikverbrauch begrenzen , JETZT !
    • Wir sollten verwenden Bio-basierter Kunststoff
    • Wir sollten Plastik nicht in die Natur bringen. Natur ist nicht unser müll !

    Persönlich, ich habe angefangen meinen Plastikkonsum einzuschränken und ich versuche immer, Bio-Produkte zu kaufen.

    Gute Nachricht !

    The Ocean Cleanup ist eine Projekt den Plastikmüll in den Ozeanen einzusammeln. Am 8. September 2018 soll das komplette System im Nordpazifikwirbel installiert werden. Dieses Projekt wird schätzungsweise 50% des meeresmülls in 5 Jahren reinigen.

    https://youtu.be/O1EAeNdTFHU

    Die nächsten Generationen brauchen eine saubere Umwelt.

    Mehr ...

    Dies sind einige Bilder aus dem Internet, um Ihnen die Auswirkungen von Plastik in der Umwelt zu zeigen.

    [gallery ids="4792,4793,4794,4795,4796,4797,4798" type="slideshow"]

  • Meine Gedanken über das neue iOS 12 !

    Apple kündigte das neue iOS 12 an das hat viele Verbesserungen. in das Blog , Ich wird spreche über das Dinge das ich mag in das neue iOS 12.

    1. Benachrichtigungen 🔔

    Meiner Meinung nach, alle vorherigen iOS-Versionen hat ein groß problem welches ist : Die Benachrichtigungen !

    iOS-Benutzer verpassen immer Ihre Benachrichtigungen wegen der alten Benachrichtigungssystem. Zum Beispiel, wann das Benutzer erhalten viele Benachrichtigungen, er kann vermisst eine wichtig Benachrichtigung, zum Beispiel eine vermisst Anrufen von seine Mutter. Apple löste dieses Problem, indem es Benachrichtigungen aus derselben Anwendung gruppierte.

    2. Bildschirmzeit ⏱️

    Bildschirmschoner ist eine neue Funktion, die Ihnen einen besseren Überblick bietet, so dass Sie das Beste aus der Zeit machen können. Sie können alle Informationen über die Zeit haben, die Sie im Bewerbung gegeben haben. Und Sie können die Zeit für jede Bewerbung begrenzen.

    3. iOS immer Respekt das Privatsphäre

    In jede neue iOS-Versionen , Apple steigern und versuche zu Privatsphäre Schutz. In diese neue Version , Apple verhinderte den Zugriff von Websites auf Browser-Cookies ohne Benutzergenehmigung. Das ist viel wichtig für das nutzer weil es Online-Tracking einschränkt.

    Gute Nachrichten!

    iOS 12 unterstützt iPhone 5S und höher. Dies ist die Liste aller unterstützten Geräte :

    iPhones :

    • iPhone X
    • iPhone 8
    • iPhone 8 Plus
    • iPhone 7
    • iPhone 7 Plus
    • iPhone 6s
    • iPhone 6s Plus
    • iPhone 6
    • iPhone 6 Plus
    • iPhone SE
    • iPhone 5s

    iPads:

    • 12,9" iPad Pro (2. Generation)
    • 12,9" iPad Pro (1. Generation)
    • 10,5" iPad Pro
    • 9,7" iPad Pro
    • iPad (6. Generation)
    • iPad (5. Generation)
    • iPad Air 2
    • iPad Air
    • iPad mini 4
    • iPad mini 3
    • iPad mini 2

     

    Wenn Sie ein Entwickler sind, können Sie die neue Version von Apple Developer Website installieren. Diese neue Version wird voraussichtlich zu Öffentlichkeit im September 2018 veröffentlicht.

     

  • Your privacy tools for 2018

    [caption id="attachment_4754" align="aligncenter" width="171"] source : iconarchive.com[/caption]

    New year , new you !

    What if you start this new year with a bunch of new tools that would help you to stay safe online and protect your privacy ? Sounds good ?

    Why you should care ?

    Internet was built to make the communication between people easier and faster. But nowadays , we could not use Internet without being tracked by third-parties (Facebook , Google , NSA ...). Who do not want to chat with his friend privately ? Who do not want to browse the Internet without seeing ads following him whenever he tape something in search engines ?

    Everyone needs to be safe and communicate with his lovely friends and family without leaving his chat history in Big Brother servers.

    What should we do ?

    It's easy to protect your privacy online just by using the following tools. Let's get into get !

    Firefox

    It's an open source web browser made by Mozilla , the non-profit organization that fights to protect our privacy.

    Mozilla is well known by its decisions against surveillance and you could see what it has done to defend Net Neutrality.

    It has also worked hard to rise public awareness about privacy by making online podcasts.

    Signal

    It's a Snowden-approved communication App that help you to use the most secure encryption algorithms to communicate with your friends.

    It's End-To-End encrypted by default , does not leave any logs on the server and provide voice and video calls.

    In 2016 , Open Whisper Systems  (the developer of Signal) has received a request from FBI to get information about two Signal users . And since Signal does not store any useful information about its users once the message is delivered and read , it gave the FBI only two useless information which are the registration date and the last time the user connected to the server.

    This App is endorsed by Snowden (see also this and this) and used by Hillary Clinton after the DNC emails revelation.

    HTTPS everywhere

    It's an Addon made by EFF that will redirect all your traffic to websites to the HTTPS version.

    Eg: If you hit " http://www.google.tn " , it will automatically redirect you to " https://www.google.tn ".

    Then , all your traffic will be encrypted so your ISP will not know what you are seeing in the website or what link you are visiting. You ISP and any man-in-the-middle will only know that your browsing Google without knowing what you are searching for.

    Privacy Badger

    It's an Addon that let you block invisible trackers. Since many websites integrate invisible trackers that will follow you across many websites that you visit , this Addon will help you block them.

    DataSelfie

    It's well known that Facebook know many things about you , more than your own family !

    This Addon will analyze your Facebook browsing and give you insights about your personality and the things that you like / hate , political opinions , the friends that you contact the most , and many other things based on what you do on Facebook.

    ProtonMail

    This is an encrypted email service that provides end-to-end encryption. Your emails will be more secure than Gmail (according to Protonmail).

     

    The most important thing !

    All the tools that I have mentioned will certainly help you to browse securely and protect your privacy BUT the most important thing is YOU , how you use the Internet ? what you share online ?

    Try to not share your sensitive information and try to share the minimum data as you could.

     

    Finally , and as Mozilla said : BROWSE FREELY !

     

  • Say Hi to Classroom chat !

    Being in a classroom prevent many colleagues from communicating with each other even for solving course related issues. The only solution that exists is using a chat App like Telegram , Facebook Messenger , WhatsApp ... But , unfortunately , all these apps require Internet and require typing in a keyboard which is time consuming. Classroom Chat is here to help you !

     

    [caption id="attachment_4312" align="aligncenter" width="293"] Classroom Chat[/caption]

     

    Based on Bluetooth , Classroom Chat , an open source App would help students to create one on one communication to easily chat without even using a keyboard. By just rotating your phone to one of the 4 positions (left side , right side , up , down) , your phone will send a preset message to your friend.

    You could set your preset messages in the App Setting (up to 4 messages). If you would like to type your custom message to tell your friend something else , you have the ability to write whatever you want by just clicking the "+" button in the bottom right of the screen (Floating Action Button).

    This App is open source , you could check all the source code in Github.

    This was a short blog post that I wanted to write to share with you my new mobile App. Stay tuned for more Apps in the near future.

     

    Built with love by Marwen Doukh.

  • Mozilla's hard work is paying off

    New stats !

    On the first day of each month , the latest statistics of browser marketshare is published by statcounter.com. And this month is no exception.

     

    [caption id="attachment_4660" align="aligncenter" width="1208"] Browser marketshare - September 2017[/caption]

     

    According to statcounter stats, we could notice that Firefox marketshare has increased from 5.73% in July 2017 to 5.9% in August 2017 , to reach 5.96% in September 2017.

    This increase is thanks to the hard work that has been done by the Mozilla community since years. I could remember well that many features has been landed in Firefox Nightly (pre-release version of Firefox for testing purpose) several months ago , and they went public recently. This shows how hard Mozilla has worked to develop, test , and improve this features before hitting the stable version.

    In a previous blog post that I have written in June 2017 (titled "Firefox : What is next ?") , I wrote about what Mozilla have done, will do , to improve Firefox and make it the most liked browser by all the Internet users.

    Finally ! Mozilla's hard work is paying off and I expect that next month Firefox marketshare will be higher.

    Can't wait to see Firefox 57 going to stable version. This new version that will be released next month will be the most revolutionary version Mozilla has ever made ! I promise you that Firefox marketshare will increase significantly after the release of Firefox 57.

    If you want to find out what Firefox 57 will be like , checkout my blog post here.

     

    Hold your breathe , 44 Days left !

     

  • How I deal with a personal secret as a software engineer ?

    [caption id="attachment_4340" align="aligncenter" width="333"] Image source[/caption]

    Telling a personal secret to someone make you more happy and more relaxed because you have shared your happiness or maybe your pain with someone else , it's load balancing , you know ! This is what software engineers think about their personal stories.

    That's why , September 25th was an unforgettable great day for me because I've shared with my best friend our mutual secret that has been kept in the dark for months .... my hard work has paid off , finally !
    The result : I have gotten a fresh friendship (version 2.0) with the best friend that has made my life so awesome all long the past months , and we promised ourselves to remain friends as long as we are alive ! and the most important thing for me is that we share the same feeling towards each other.

    Sometimes we do not get what we are looking for and we are not able to achieve our goals due to many issues out of our control. That said, we should always keep in mind that life keeps its secret and will show them up at the right moment. This was a wise quote from my awesome friend , I will save it in my mind for my lifetime.

    What happened two days ago , is thanks to the wise suggestions of someone that worked behind the scene , another great friend that helped me in my taught situation.

    On July , I have invited my best friend to talk about our mutual secret but he was a bit confused so he didn't tell me noting . After two months , things have changed and he become now able to speak fluently about our friendship , congrats buddy for being so honest , you rock !
    Believe it or not : You should always say what you would say no matter what you are afraid of !

    Being surrounded with great people not only make you more motivated to work hard and change the way you see the future , it also help you to live in the best conditions , that you could not find elsewhere. That's what I feel now after renewing my friendship with my best friend !

    As you may probably know , airplane companies never close the case of an airplane crash only if it get all the details of what caused the issue in order to correct the previous errors and make the next edition better. It should get the truth , the true issue, not a fake cause , even if this may affect their brand. Applying this to my story , you could never have the best relationship , if you do not be as honest as you have to be and tell the right things to the right person at the right time.

    Finally , my advice to you is you have to be honest , fluent with the people around you and always say the truth at the right moment to prevent issues from happening. Just run this code :

    for (Friend friend : friends) {
    revealEverything(friend,Me.getFeelings());
}

     

    Just one last thing that I would like to tell to my best friend :

    "Be always honest with the people around you , always tell them what you feel about them. Also , have a self confidence and do not underestimate your POWER !!" . From your best friend Marwen.

  • MoVility 2017 : 3rd prize winner !

    My team and I , have participated in the MoVility 2017 challenge with our project "Happy Ho" and we won the third prize . In this article , I will tell you what we've learned during this event and why you should consider participating in next year's edition.

    Before getting into it , I would like to thank every member in my team , Binary Team :

    • Chawki Satouri
    • Amine Zouai
    • Mohamed Amine Znaidi
    • Zeineb Ben Aouicha

    And I would like also to thank Mr Mohamed Amine Messaoud for his help all long the event .

    We participated in the MoVility challenge with a project that we simply called it "Happy Ho" (as an abbreviation for happy hotel). The idea came up to our minds when deeply thinking about making feedback gathering as easy as possible , using technology. We noticed that the current feedback gathering processes takes too much time for both collecting and processing data.

    That is why our innovative team made "Happy Ho" that will help Hotels to easily gather customer's feedback without bothering him nor taking too much from his time . It is a connected , intelligent Box that could be easily implemented inside the hotel . This Box will automatically measure the satisfaction rate related to the different hotel services, since many Boxes will be implemented near every Hotel service ( such as the restaurant , the swimming pool , the lobby ...)  That is a quick overview of our project , if you need more details please do not hesitate to contact me.

    Training sessions

    As part of the challenge, many training sessions had been planned that helped us to improve our project idea and to ameliorate our presentation skills specially that during the final the room will be full of very important people such as CEOs , Businessmen , Entrepreneurs ...

    During these sessions we have learned a lot of new things and I want to mention the most important one for me which is :

    "When you come up with a new idea , you should always keep in mind that it won't be successful only if it solves a customer's issue and it should be is very simple to implement and use ".

    In the past , I used to got a lot of ideas that sounds very interesting but they do not succeed because simply the customer do not need all that complicated product !

    Moreover , asking the customer if he likes your idea and if he is willing to buy it from you is always mandatory for the Startup success .

    All long the workshops , we have done many presentations in which we have got many criticism and many great, constructive feedback that surely has been very helpful for us.

    The final

    The final was held in Citroën Club , in Lac 1 (Tunis, Tunisia) , so my team and I went early to get enough time for the preparation and to meet the other participants. Honestly, I liked how everyone is smiling and wishing the best to the participant teams.

    Mr Oualid Triki introduced the project and gave me the floor to present our idea in 5 minutes which was enough time for me to say Hi and to try to convince the room that our project solves a real issue and that they should invest in "Happy Ho".
    It was really great to present the project in front of CEOs and Businessmen specially that after the presentation , they gave me a lot of feedback and ideas . I will certainly improve the things that I have missed during my presentation .

    The announcement

    During the break, everyone got a cup of juice and started exchanging business cards  , there are plenty of opportunities out there , who knows ?
    After talking about the possible opportunities with the attendees , it is time to announce who are the winners of MoVility 2017 challenge . We took a seat and we focused on the winners announcement. I was a bit stressed but I was sure that reaching this stage of the event and meeting all these people is the real win.
    "The 3rd prize is for ...... Happy Ho! " applause ...   This is the best thing I have ever heard!
    I can't feel better than winning such a great challenge . I want to thank once again all my teammates and the people that helped us to win .

    After the challenge ...

    Personally , this great journey helped me to improve my skills and to think differently about business specially when building the project idea.

    After the challenge , we got a lot of new opportunities varying from jobs to partnerships. My team and I , are currently planning to build our startup and we committed ourselves to work hard to succeed this project.

    I have no doubt that the next year's winners will have better ideas , so if you are a student and you read this article , I highly recommend that you participate in MoVility in the next year and I hope that you start thinking about the winning idea starting from now. I would be glad if I could help you to build your idea by providing my feedback or even by providing technical support . Contact me when needed !

  • Introduction to Artificial Intelligence

    Artificial Intelligence have become one of the most important and interesting topics over the past few years , it gave computers the ability to "think" and to be "intelligent" . Unlike "old" programs and algorithms in which you should define and deal with every condition , AI algorithms can predict the action based on a training . What is AI ? What is Machine Learning ? What is Artificial Neural Network ? How could we train it ?

    Before the AI era

    In old programs , the output does not change over time and does not learn from training . Every thing should be written in the source code , every input should be included in the program . Whenever you have a new or a change in your input , you should update your program . This can be a huge problem when dealing with data and input that change frequently , specially if you could not predict them .

    Let's take the following example :

    You have program that take the model and the speed of a car as an input and gives you fuel consumption as output . How could you develop this program ?

    Let's think for a minute ...

    We have to manage all the models , and for every model all the possible car's speed ! This is very hard ! and unfeasible !

    Artificial Intelligence will solve this problem ! Congrats !

    What is Artificial Intelligence ?

    An AI , is a program that given an input , it'll predict the output , even if it doesn't know any think about that specific input (It doesn't know fuel consumption of this specific model at this specific speed) ! How it predict that ?

    What is Machine Learning?

    To build an Artificial Intelligence program , you have to train it using examples (many real car's consumption) . This way , your program will learn from this data and try to understand how car's consumption increase according to speed and car's model . The more data you give to your program , the more accurate it'll be : All this without any change in source code .So , how machine learning works ? How your program learn ?

    Well ! It will do a Linear Regression to draw a line that cross the majority of points, like the following image :

     

    [caption id="attachment_3484" align="aligncenter" width="800"] Linear Regression[/caption]

    For example :

    • X : represents car's speed .
    • Y: represents fuel consumption.

    What is Artificial Neural Network ?

    Machine Learning is how to train our program to learn about our data .As we've seen earlier , Linear Regression is one of the methods to do that .

    Artificial Neural Network is a new technique in machine learning that is inspired by human neurons. It is composed by "neurons" which has inputs and according to the input it calculates a value as an output .

    Back the our example , to solve our issue we have to build an ANN that have 2 inputs :car model and car speed and 1 output : the fuel consumption . How to train it in order to predict the fuel consumption ?

    How to train an Artificial Neural Network ?

    There are two best tools to build and then train an ANN (Artificial Neural Network):

    -Scikit

    -TensorFlow : developed by Google for building advanced algorithms.

    In our example , we should then build an ANN with 2 inputs , 1 output and we give it as many data as we can to train it . As we mentioned above , the neuron output depends on its input , so in each learning round (epochs) the output for the same input change to become more accurate .What !

    I'll explain . Let's say in round 1 (the first epoch) , the output of the neuron is calculated according to the following equation :

    0.4*input1+0.2*input2 = output

    This will give an accuracy ,for example, of 70% of our ANN  .

    In the second epoch , the ANN will try to improve the accuracy by changing the first equation , so it'll be for example :

    0.46*input1+0.199*input2 = output

    Giving this equation , the ANN will have an accuracy of 75% , so our ANN improved itself by learning from each epoch and each input.

    In each epoch , our ANN calculates the accuracy of the model and tries to improve it in the next epoch . (You could set the number of epoch as you want).

    To conclude

    AI is the evolution of computer algorithms that will surely help Humans make better decisions and to predict many things . Many big companies already started using AI in their products , like Google assistant , Alexa (Amazon) , Google search engine ...

    I am pretty sure that we will see AI in more products and programs in the near future , hoping that it will beneficial for the end user .

  • How to work/study effectively from home ?

    [caption id="attachment_3862" align="aligncenter" width="364"] Source : joeycariano Instagram account[/caption]

    Working or studying from home is an issue for many people because they find all the entertainment stuff they want available for them and easy to access such as TV , video game console ... That is why many people prefer to finish all their tasks before going home because they are pretty sure that all their plans will fail .

    But , what if we do not have the right to stay at work after 6pm and we should do some tasks from home ?

    Motivation 🏊‍

    Motivation is a key for success . You should motivate yourself to stay focused on your work and to not get disturbed by all the things going is your home ,even if your baby cry.

    I will share with you my personal tip that usually works great with me . Staying in front of a computer for 5 or 8 hours in a row to develop a software is not an easy task , so I motivate myself by saying :

    "Hey Marwen ! if you do a great job today , you will go ride the bike , or you will watch your favorite TV series , it is up to you "

    This way , I feel that after doing and finishing my work , I'll get a reward so I get motivated and work harder to obtain it .

    Stay focused 🎯

    Even with motivation , sometimes you find yourself distracted because of e-mails , notifications , phone calls , someone asks for your help ... To solve these issues try to respond to e-mail , messages once every 15min or 30min , because responding to everything as soon as you hear the notification will certainly make you loose your focus and you will notice that 1 hour has passed without doing any progress in your work.

    Stay organized 🕐

    Try your best to stick to the plan and commit yourself to do the tasks as you planned.

    Sometimes when you plan to do Task 1 then Task 2 then .... you notice that you prefer doing Task 3 at first because all the other tasks needs more attention and more time.

    Even so , try to do everything as planned and motivate yourself to do what you planned for because a good plan is the key for success.

    That being said , you should know your skills and how much time it will takes to finish every task before setting the plan, and DO NOT plan for something that you could not accomplish (this will makes you feel down and you will underestimate yourself ).

    Go for a walk 🚶🏼

    As I mentioned above , staying in front of a computer for several hours is not an easy task and it could affect your health . So , once in a while try to go for a walk (even in the house) , this will make you willing to finish the remaining work with more motivation and of course protect your health.

    Finally Get the reward ! 🥇

    After finishing your work , and if everything worked like a charm , do not forget to get the reward that you promised yourself  to obtain. This will make you credible and next time you will work harder to get the reward !

     

    I hope that this article help you to do well in the future and if you have any other tips that could help us , please feel free to share it in the comment section below .

  • Firefox : What is next ?

    Firefox is getting many improvements over the last months , it is getting better day after day . What is next ? How Firefox could be the best alternative to Chrome ?

    Firefox marketshare

     

     

    As of May 2017 (according to statcounter.com) , Firefox have 6.21% of internet users (comparing to 54.14% to Chrome) . I wanted to know what are the main reasons of this decrease , so I asked many friends of mine : "Why don't you use Firefox and why you ditched it ?" .

    I got almost the same answer : "I have been using Firefox since I have had Internet , but in the last few years I noticed that Firefox had many issues like lack of speed , lack of features and improvements . So I installed Chrome and I was amazed by its speed and simple user experience . Since then , I never thought to retry Firefox " .

    Honestly , they are somehow right and we can not deny that .

    Given all the issues mentioned above , I will give you some of the things that Mozilla will do to improve Firefox and to fix all its issues . This indicates that Mozilla is always listening to its users and always trying to improve !

    What Mozilla have done

    As you may probably know , Mozilla announced a new version of Firefox few days ago. This version have 'Electrolysis' (e10s) turned on , which means that instead of using a single process to run all your web pages , Firefox will use up to 4 processes to run your web pages faster and smoother . Unlike Chrome which use a process per web page , Firefox found the right balance between memory usage and speed (more processes means more memory usage) . After updating to version 54 , you will notice that Firefox is faster , smoother and of course use less memory then Chrome.

    Furthermore , Mozilla acquired Pocket which is an app that let you manage your bookmarks and web pages that you need to read it later . Pocket will help Mozilla to improve the Context Graph project which aims to suggest to the users web pages and articles they may interest them .

    In addition , you could sync all your browser history and bookmarks across all your devices . The best thing I like about this feature is when I visit a website from my mobile device and I want to see it later in my computer , I could easily send it to my PC .And as soon as I launch Firefox in my computer , a new tab of the website I have sent will be opened .

    You could see all the other Firefox features here.

    What Mozilla will do

    Since I am using Firefox Nightly  (the Alpha version of Firefox ) , I could notice the improvements daily and what will be added to Firefox . All I could say is "WOW !" .

    First off , Firefox will get new visual refresh in the near future (project Photon) that started landing to Firefox Nightly to make its UI more simple.

    As part of this UI refresh , the Firefox logo will also get some refinements . I am really excited to see what it will look like !

    Second off , when you open a new blank tab , in addition to the top sites that you have visited , you will see suggestions of websites that you may want to visit (from Pocket , like I mentioned earlier) as well as the previous web pages that you just visited . This new feature will help you find your top sites faster and find new articles easier.

    Moreover , Addons will get a big change and you will be able to port Addons across browsers .

    Many users struggle to take a web page screenshot, that is why Firefox will introduce a new feature called "Firefox Screenshots" . It aims to simplify screenshot taking and saving them online . (Just to tell you , I used it to take the above statistics screenshot). You could choose how long you want to keep the screenshot by setting the expiring period or you could simply save it to your computer . You could take a look here to see an image taken using this new feature.

    In my previous Blog post (in Arabic) , I wrote about the "Containers" feature that allows you to connect to the same website with different accounts in the same browser ! Translation ? You could for example connect to many Gmail accounts in Firefox (without opening a private window) , one for your work , one for your personal use , and so on ... This feature give you more Privacy control over what data you share with websites.

    Wrap up

    I would like to invite you to switch back to Firefox because it is getting better day after day , specially with all the new features that I mentioned . Surely , it will be far better faster , and simpler than Chrome in the near future.

    Of course , Mozilla won't stop here , it will improve Firefox more and more ... and more .

    You could switch to Firefox by installing the latest version from here . Don't worry about your browsing history and bookmarks , you could easily import them to Firefox .

  • Why to install Firefox Nightly ?

     

    Many people asks : "How can I help Mozilla ? I'm not familiar with programming !" . Then answer is "Use Firefox Nightly !".

    In this blog post , we'll find out why Nightly is important and what you can do for Mozilla .

    What is Nightly ?

    In software development process , any program version have a life cycle , like we Humans , Alpha , Beta and release .

    Alpha is the version that contains the latest features and technology , it not available to public because it's unstable and under testing.

    Beta is almost stable version of the software , but it needs more testing to make sure it does not contain bugs or security issues.

    Release is the most stable version of the software and it is available to public . It has been tested for many weeks and almost all the issues were fixed by developers.

    Back to the main topic , Nightly is the alpha version of Firefox , it contains the most newest Firefox features that are not available to public ,it is under continuous testing by the community.

    How can I help Mozilla ?

    As we mentioned above , Nightly is unstable and contains the latest features , so Mozilla should test these features before making it publicly available .When installing Nightly , it will send anonymous data about how much RAM it consumes , how much it takes to start , how many times it crashes and the crash's cause ... (with all the respect to your privacy)  all those information will help the community to fix bugs and improve Firefox.

    All the Mozilla community is working hard every day to make Firefox better whether by coding or testing. So you can be part of this and help to shape the next version of Firefox by simply installing Firefox Nightly and reporting any issue or bug you find.

    If you want to test a more stable version of Firefox , you can install Firefox Beta from here , it's the last chance to catch bugs before landing user's computers.

    What is coming next ?

    I've been using Firefox Nightly for more than a year , and during all this period , I'm receiving a new update every day , YES ! every day ! and I can notice that Firefox is improved day after day , new features are added , speed is improved , new privacy features are included regularly .

    Since Mozilla is open , it shares periodically blog posts to tell the community what is coming next and what are the features that were added in the previous weeks , you can follow it by visiting the Firefox Nightly blog.

    Finally , I would like to show you one of the most video I like , it summarize everything about Mozilla and I'm sure after watching it , you will set Firefox as your default browser.

    [youtube https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LtOGa5M8AuU&w=560&h=315]

    You can install Firefox Nightly from here .

  • Introduction to IoT

    The IoT is becoming  among the most interesting topics over the last years because it will have a huge impact on our life in the next few years . According to experts , the world will see a big change at the dawn of 2020 , they called it : The IoT revolution !

    What is the IoT ?

    IoT , stands for "Internet Of Things" . At the moment , no one have the exact definition of IoT because it's changing and growing day after day .

    Gartner defined it as : A network of physical objects that contain embedded technology to communicate and sense or interact with their internal states or the external environment.

    The Guardian defined it as : it’s about connecting devices over the internet, letting them talk to us, applications, and each other.

    My own definition for the IoT would be :

    " The IoT is connecting  many devices over the Internet in order to gather , process and make decisions using its data ".

    In fact , we called it Internet of THINGS because we don't know yet what are these THINGS . It could be a fridge , a TV , a sensor .... and any device connected to the internet .

    Why the IoT ?

    The world have had two technological revolutions . The first one was when the humans needed to exchange data and information between them => We had the computer revolution .

    After many years , the humans required that the devices they use should be portable and smaller => We had the smartphone revolution

    These two revolutions has successfully satisfied our needs in terms of Human To Human communication . But , the human needs has evolved again !

    Nowadays , we have all the tools we need to communicate effectively but we need to communicate to our environment , we need to communicate with all the devices around us : the light bulb , the air conditioner , the traffic lights ... and the all the THINGS (like we defined them above) .

    So , the world should have another revolution that makes the Humans to Things communication possible , and this is feasible only through the IoT revolution !

    How this could affects our life ?

    As I said above , nowadays we are no longer satisfied by the data we get from our environment. By environment I mean  every thing around us . Let's take the following example :

    You have a garden with wonderful flowers and you are always looking after them . Imagine you get to travel for two weeks for job purposes . What a problem ! Your flowers will certainly die if they are not watered during all this period !

    What if you have a smart watering system that monitor the ground moisture and that could fetch for the weather forecast ! Combining these two information : ground moisture and the weather forecast , we could ensure an effective watering system that could water the flowers if the ground is dry and that will not if it will be rainy in one hour . You could travel without the fear that you'll lost your flowers !

    This is one of many examples for using the IoT in our daily life , I'll give you few applications for the IoT :

    • Medical purposes : A device that periodically sends your grandma blood test results to the doctor and alerting him if anything went wrong.
    • Transportation : Locating the nearest bus and the time it takes to arrive.
    • Road traffic : Detecting the traffic jam and suggesting new ways for the drivers to avoid the congestion.
    • Health care : Detecting the expiry date of each product in the fridge and automatically ordering new products from the nearest supermarket .

    And so on ... The IoT applications can't have any limits since many IoT products shows up daily .

    Building the infrastructure

    The IoT is a topic that is highly linked to many other topics , we cannot talk about it without mentioning the Business Intelligence , network security , IPv6 , 5G , privacy (we will talk about it later) , power consumption , cloud computing ...

    That's why we could not have an IoT revolution without carefully preparing the infrastructure for billions of devices (34 billion by 2020 according to businessinsider ).

    Billions of devices connected to the internet simultaneously means we should ensure enough IP addresses for every device , so we should  deploy the IPv6 because the actual IPv4 can only ensure approximately 4.3 billion public IP address . I'll not dive into the details because it's not our main topic but , keep in mind that IPv6 can ensure approximately three hundred and forty trillion, trillion unique IP addresses (according to Apple) .

    Generally speaking, an IoT device is a totally independent device that is connected to the internet using wireless technologies like the future 5G that will ensure best data rate , low latency, best coverage than the actual 4G technology .

    Once these devices got an IP address and successfully connected to internet , we should ensure the Confidentiality, Integrity , Availability of the data they'll send . The network security is fundamental and must not be treated as optional , we should not give the hackers any opportunity to intercept this data because it will cause the worst scenario you could image.

    After that , we should ensure the platform that could handle Yottabytes of data (1 trillion terabytes) . Many companies started offering their cloud solutions but it should be improved more and more in order to be able to do the next step effectively : Processing that data .

    Once the data landed safely on our servers , we will start our process that aims to extract the most valuable information from this data .In the past few years , many universities added the business intelligence as an important field of study to ensure the best engineers that will give this data a new life and to make best decisions .

    We should be careful !

    We talked above about how could our life be better and easier using the IoT . But , like any other technology , the IoT have some bad sides . Don't be afraid ! I'll give you the solutions to this problems .

    The first thing that came to our minds when we talk about IoT is PRIVACY .More personal information about us will be stored in the companies servers : More IoT means Less privacy !

    I'll illustrate it by the following schema :

    more IoT devices ==> more data ==> more relevant information ==> best profiling of you

    Once they build your profile , they could show you targeted ads , they could know your needs so they manufacture a new products for you , they could make more money from your data .

    I'm pretty sure that most of the audience say :

    " Who cares ! I have nothing to hide ! "

    Yeah , you have the right to don't care , but keep in mind that combining the information of  you , your family , your neighbors , the  inhabitants of your city , the  inhabitants of your entire country , those information could be more dangerous ! Don't you agree ?

    Another big issue has happened last month , when a hacker did the most big DDOS attack ever (sending too much requests to a server until he goes down) ! He used IoT devices to make this attack against big websites .

    So , what's the solution ?

    To ensure a healthy IoT world , we should first of all secure every information system we build : Security is mandatory ! We've moved some steps toward this goal by offering free TLS certificates from a project called "Let's encrypt" sponsored by many big companies.

    The most important thing is using open solutions to build IoT systems and I'm very glad to see Mozilla working in this field. It's preparing awesome projects like Rust which is a programming language and Sensor Web which is a platform to collect data from different sensors worldwide and make its data available to anyone : for example , you can get the air quality in China without investing in sensors there .

     

    Conclusion ...

    The IoT is an arm with two edges , either we use it in the right way to make better decisions and to improve our life , or we use it to destroy the internet, the internet that we've built for years !

    I'm very optimistic for the future of the IoT , I'm pretty sure that it will make our life easier and helps us get more from our environment. We have to wait for 2020 to see what will happen !

  • Face detection with OpenCV

     

    OpenCV is an open source library for image processing and object detection. In this tutorial we'll create a Python program that detect and draw a rectangle around the detected face.

    To detect objects , openCV analyze the image and extract its characteristics and compare them to a classifier which is a file that describes the faces characteristics.

    What is a classifier ?

    A classifier (a file) is the result of analyzing each pixel of an image and extracting its characteristics. This file will be used to detect objects or persons in an image by comparing its characteristics with the classifier.

    The more you train the classifier , the more accurate results will be .Classifier training is based on a dataset (images containing the object that you want to detect).

    To illustrate :

    If you want to create a classifier that detect cars in an image , you have to prepare a dataset of car images of all categories , colors , manufacturers ... try to prepare as much pictures as you can  : images of Volkswagen cars , BMW cars , black cars , white cars , 4*4 cars , sport cars and so on ...

    The classifier needs this images (positive images) to understand how cars look like , but it needs also a dataset that contains negatives images , images that contains anything except cars : pictures of trucks , boats , airplanes ... You get the point.

    In our case , detecting faces , openCV offers a trained classifier that was trained using hundreds of images and since its under a free to redistribute license , we'll use it in our project.

    Start developing

    First , we need to import openCV library for python :

    import cv2

    Since we'll give the file name in the program parameters , we need to import "sys"

    import sys

    Then import the openCV face detection classifier

    faceCascade = cv2.CascadeClassifier('haarcascade_frontalface_default.xml')

    Import the image that its file name is given in parameters , it should be in the same directory as the python program.

    image = cv2.imread(sys.argv[1])

    Now, we'll do the most important part , detecting the face using the classifier.

    faces = faceCascade.detectMultiScale(
        #the image to use
        image,
        scaleFactor=1.1,
        minNeighbors=5,
        #specify the minimal object size , if it is smaller than 20*20 it will not be retained
        minSize=(20, 20)
    )

    Once the face is detected , let's draw a red rectangle around it

    for (x, y, w, h) in faces:
   cv2.rectangle(image, (x, y), (x+w, y+h), (255, 0, 0), 2)

    Finally , show the final image and do not close it until the user press a button

    cv2.imshow("face", image)
cv2.waitKey(0)

     

    Testing

    Choose one of your face images , put it in the same directory as the python program and run:

    python face-detection.py yourface.jpg

     

    The result will be like this

     

    [caption id="attachment_3197" align="aligncenter" width="393"] Mr bean face detected[/caption]

     

    You can get the full source code from here

     

     

     

  • Bluemix : Connect IBM DashDB to IBM Cognos Analytics

    Cognos Analytics is an IBM Business Intelligence tool that you can use to interpret your data and extract relevant information for your Database.In this tutorial , we will add a new data source to Cognos Analytics , from DashDB , and create charts. Let's get started !

    What is DashDB ?

    DashDB is a data warehouse developed by IBM that you can use to gather data from different databases and different sources.

    Connect DashDB to Cognos Analytics

    Connect to your Cognos account and click "manage" (in the bottom left) .

    [caption id="attachment_3355" align="aligncenter" width="677"] Click manage[/caption]

    Then , click "Data server connections"

    [caption id="attachment_3359" align="aligncenter" width="675"] Click data server connections[/caption]

    Click the + button and choose DashDB

    [caption id="attachment_3363" align="aligncenter" width="1366"] Choose DashDB[/caption]

    Now , we have to enter the DashDB credentials , so go to your DashDB dashboard , click "connect" and copy , paste the required fields . (copy Host name and paste it in "Server")

    [caption id="attachment_3366" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] Copy your credentials[/caption]

    When you're done , test if the connection can be established by clicking "test" , you should see this

    [caption id="attachment_3369" align="aligncenter" width="573"] Test the connection[/caption]

    After clicking the "Ok" button , click on the database you just created .

    Then click on your connection name , and next to your schema name (DashDB table name) , click "Load metadata"

    [caption id="attachment_3373" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] Load metadata[/caption]

    As of now , we successfully connected Cognos to DashDB . The next step is to create a new data source for Cognos , it will get data from the server connection we just created .

    Click the + button and choose "Data module"

    [caption id="attachment_3376" align="aligncenter" width="1363"] Create a new data module[/caption]

    Click "Data servers", then choose the "Data server" we just created .After that check the schema (DashDB table name) , and finally click "Start".

    [caption id="attachment_3379" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] Setup data module[/caption]

    Expand the "Data sources" , then drag and drop the table name you want to work on. Click "save" (on the top left).

    Tip: Save it in "My content" folder to make it easier to find it later.

    [caption id="attachment_3382" align="aligncenter" width="1366"] Save data module[/caption]

    Everything now is well set up . To use those data , add a new Dashboard

    [caption id="attachment_3385" align="aligncenter" width="1363"] Add new Dashboard[/caption]

    In the new dashboard , we need to choose the data we want to process , so click the "+" button and choose the data source we just created (if you followed my tip , you'll find it in "My content" folder ;)  ).

    [caption id="attachment_3388" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] Add data source to Dashboard[/caption]

    Finally , you can create your charts and process the DashDB data.Just drag and drop the values from your data source into your charts.

    [caption id="attachment_3392" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] Add charts[/caption]

    Enjoy !

    Don't forget to save your Dashboard , so you can consult it in the future.

    Charts

    In my project , I get data from sensors and I can see the temperature , humidity , noise values over time and I can also notice that the average temperature dropped dramatically while other values remained stable at a certain point of time.

    [caption id="attachment_3396" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] IBM Cognos : Charts[/caption]

  • VR weather with A-frame

     

    A-frame is a Mozilla web framework for building Virtual Reality scenes. In this tutorial , we'll develop a web page that displays the weather's conditions and change the scene sky according to weather. (We will choose Ariana , Tunisia as an example).

    What is Aframe ?

    A-Frame is an open-source web framework by Mozilla that makes building virtual reality  (VR) experiences easier , with just HTML tags. It's build using three.js framework.

    How to use it ?

    You can develop a VR scene and open the web page you created with your browser .If you  are using your computer you move inside the scene by your mouse. If you are using your smartphone , install a VR compatible web browser like Firefox and move inside the scene by moving your phone (using your phone accelerometer ).

    Let's start developing

    We'll create a PHP file , and insert HTML tags according to the weather

    First , we should import the A-frame library , add this in your head tag

    https://aframe.io/releases/0.5.0/aframe.min.js

    As of writing this tutorial , this is the latest A-frame version.

    The head tag will be like

     <head>
        <meta charset="utf-8">

  • Android Layouts tutorial

    After posting the weather app tutorial , many friends asked me to do a tutorial about how to organize Android Views (TextView , ImageView ...) inside a UI. So in this tutorial, we'll find out how to make better UI.

    Android UI is designed using XML files , thus, it's based on tags. It's recommended that you be familiar with XML.

    LinearLayout VS RelativeLayout

    Both LinearLayout and RelativeLayout , are containers that holds other Views like TextView , ImageView , Button ...
    The difference between them , is how they organize the items that it contains.

    LinearLayout

    A LinearLayout organize Views either vertically or horizontally .
    A LinearLayout with vertical orientation , put Views one below the other

    <LinearLayout
    android:layout_width="match_parent"
    android:layout_height="match_parent"
    android:orientation="vertical"
    >

  • Consuming REST web service from Android

    Hello Android developer !

    In this tutorial , we'll develop an Android App that call a weather web service to display the weather's condition for Ariana,Tunisia (just an example).

    If you want to make your own web service , check out my tutorial here .

    At the end of this tutorial , you'll find the Github link of the full source code , it contains more features (everything is explained by comments).

    Let's get started !

    Before start developing , you have to create an account in openweathermap to get an API key (If you don't want to do this step , you can use mine).

    If you are familiar with creating Android projects , skip to the next step

    Create an Android project

    To create an Android project , go to File-New-New Project

    [caption id="attachment_2531" align="aligncenter" width="379"] Create new Android project[/caption]

    Then enter your Android project name. The package name will be used as an ID of your App , so try to make it unique.

    [caption id="attachment_2543" align="aligncenter" width="448"] Enter Android App name[/caption]

    Select the minimum SDK , this means the lowest Android version that your App can run on.

    In this example , our App will run on Android 4.0.3 and above.

    [caption id="attachment_2571" align="aligncenter" width="517"] Select the Minimum SDK[/caption]

    In Android , an activity is composed by a JAVA class and an XML file : JAVA for the processing and XML for the interface.So , in this step , we'll create the first activity in the App.

    [caption id="attachment_2554" align="aligncenter" width="1080"] Create new Activity[/caption]

    Enter the JAVA class name (Activity name) and the XML file name (Layout name)

    [caption id="attachment_2575" align="aligncenter" width="1079"] Enter the Activity name and Layout name[/caption]

    Finally ! Our Android project was created successfully.

    [caption id="attachment_2560" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] Android project is created[/caption]

    Every Android project is composed by 3 main files :

    • Android manifest (XML file) : This file contains all the information about the App such as the activities that it contains and the App permissions
    • MainActivity (JAVA file)
    • activity_main.xml (XML file for the layout)
    • build.gradle : It contains the App version and all the dependencies

    Adding App dependencies

    We need 2 dependencies the first one is Volley , a library that makes HTTP requests easier.

    And Glide , a library that makes downloading and displaying images in the App easier.

    To add those libraries , add this to build.gradle (Module : App) file

    (you will find it in Gradle.Scripts section)

    compile 'com.android.volley:volley:1.0.0'
compile 'com.github.bumptech.glide:glide:3.7.0'

    After making change in build.gradle file , Gradle will ask you to do a project sync , Click Sync Now to import the 2 libraries.

    [caption id="attachment_2611" align="aligncenter" width="977"] Gradle needs to sync[/caption]

    App permissions

    Since we'll make a HTTP request to retrieve the weather conditions , we need to ask for INTERNET PERMISSION from the user.

    We need also to know if the user have an Internet connection or not , so we'll ask for ACCESS NETWORK STATE PERMISSION as well.

    Add this to AndroidManifest.xml , before the application tag.

    <!--Request Internet connection-->
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />
 <!--Request to check Internet connection state-->
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE" />

    Preparing the GUI

    In our interface , we need 2 TextViews to display the temperature and weather description , and 1 ImageView to show a background according the weather condition. Open activity_main.xml , this file describe how will be our user interface.

    First , we set the background image , it will cover the entire screen (match_parent)

     <!--background image-->

  • Mozilla Campus Clubs

    Hello Mozillian !

    At this end of October 2016 , I've been in Casablanca in Morocco for 4 days to attend the Mozilla Arabic Gathering 2016. Roughly 30 Mozillians were present to discuss the new Mozilla projects and to make our strategy for the next years . I wrote a blog post to summarize what we've done , you can check it here .

    In this article , I'll dive into the details of the Mozilla Campus Clubs session that has been presented by Christos in the Mozilla Arabic Gathering 2016 .

     

     

    The Mozilla Campus Clubs definition

    A quick definition for a Mozilla Campus Club would be :

    "A group of people who meet regularly to teach , learn , discuss  .... Simply , to make a difference in the Web " .

    Why Mozilla created this new program ? We already have the FSA !

    Before talking about this new born project , I would like to give you some historical information .

    Mozilla has started a project called "Firefox Student Ambassadors" or FSA . It's a project that focuses mainly on the Firefox browser . As an FSA , our main mission was to teach students about Firefox . This project has some points that should be improved like the reporting . Mozilla doesn't have a clear idea about what an FSA did or what he is planning for . Another very important thing , everyone could become an FSA simply by submitting an online form , without any courses or any coaching , he will talk to people about the Mozilla mission . I thing that could cause some problems because not every student knows well about the Mozilla mission and the Mozilla principles .

    Given all the above points , Mozilla start thinking how it could improve the FSA program and how to make the Mozillian mission easier . And PAM PAM ! It announced the Mozilla Campus Clubs !

    What is a Mozilla Campus Club ?

    As we defined it above , it's a group of people passionate about technology ,  not only the Mozilla products ,  who help each others to learn and to advance their knowledge . And as its name indicates , is focusing on the universities and the students . It's founded by student , in a student campus , to the students ! It couldn't be better !

    Mozilla is committed to keep the web open , safe and accessible to everyone . So , a campus club is the better solution to spread the web literacy and to fuel the student innovation .

    Mozilla Campus Clubs doesn't require any expensive resources to run :  a venue (it could be any place clean , safe and accessible) , and some members are enough to do a great job.Because the main goal of a Mozilla Campus Club is not gathering as much resources and swags as you can , but it's learning and teaching as much as you can !

    As I mentioned above , the FSA program doesn't offer any resources or coaching that helps students spread the Mozilla mission effectively . That's why before starting his Mozilla Campus Club , the Club captain (The club founder / leader ) should follow an online course made by Mozilla that covers everything he should know. As of the time of writing this article , I'm still following the course and personally  I liked it so much but it can be improved by focusing more on visual materials (videos , pictures ) instead of text .

    Why should I start a Mozilla Campus Club ?

    Mozilla specifically and the open source in general , is based on sharing : sharing experience , sharing knowledge , sharing ideas .... sharing everything that could help others .

    This fully aligns with the Mozilla Campus Clubs goal which is based on the same principle : Sharing .

    Personally , and according to my personal experience , I think that teaching others about something makes you master it better and the audience questions will make you more excited to learn new things .

    I want to start a Mozilla Campus Club , what should I do ?

    Before starting a club , I highly encourage you to follow the Mozilla course , it will give you a clear vision about Mozilla mission and principles because you should be able to answer all the students questions and help them understand what is Mozilla .

    If you are asking how to start it , all the process is mentioned in the Mozilla Campus Clubs website , every step is detailed .

    Briefly ...

    A Mozilla Campus Clubs is a group of people that meet in a safe / clean place to teach and learn technology . Every student who want to join this program , will be certainly guided by Mozilla so he will never be lost .

    I'm very thankful to a great person  who gave me all those information during the Mozilla Arabic Gathering 2016 in Morocco  : It's Christos Bacharakis , from Mozilla . Thank you once again :)

    I hope that the Mozilla Campus Club program will help students from all around the world to learn new things and I hope that it will be the manufacturer for a new fleet of developers , open web fighters , and of course new Mozillians !

  • "Rust Translator" : translate words with Rust ...

    Rust is a new systems programming language made by Mozilla , it's extremely fast !

    In this tutorial we'll develop a program in Rust that translate words using the Yandex Translator API.

    Installing Rust

    Rust is always changing , this tutorial is made with version 1.14.0 (released in December 22, 2016).

    To install the latest Rust version , run this command in your Terminal

    curl https://sh.rustup.rs -sSf | sh

    Create a new project

    Cargo is a package manager for Rust , it also create projects , build , and run it .

    To create a new Rust project , run

    cargo new RustTranslator --bin

     - -bin indicates that we are creating a binary program and not a library.

    Once you created the project , two files will be created

    • Cargo.toml : contains the project dependencies and information (developer,version ...)
    • main.rs : contains our source code

    Go to src , with

    cd src

    to run the program , run

    cargo run

    This will prompt a simple hello world

    Hello, world!

    Import dependencies

    Open Cargo.toml and add

    [dependencies]
hyper = "0.10.0"
rustc-serialize = "0.3"
hyper-native-tls = "0.2"

    Our project needs those libraries :

    • Hyper : will help us make HTTP requests to get the word's translation from Yandex API
    • rustc-serialize : will help us parse the HTTP result
    • hyper-native-tls : Since Yandex Translator API is available in HTTPS , we need this library to make HTTP request to encrypted web services

    To import it to the project , run

    cargo update

    Just wait , this depends on your Internet speed.

    Coding ...

    We just finished importing the libraries we need , now we have to tell Rust that we will use it in our program . To do so , open  main.rs and add :

    extern crate hyper;
extern crate rustc_serialize;
extern crate hyper_native_tls;

  • My expectations for 2017

    During 2016 we've seen many great products that changed our life and also there are a lot of news happened that affected the tech world like the US election. There is always something new to come in the tech world , and obviously 2017 will not be an exception. In this blog post , I'll tell you, briefly, my expectations for this year 2017.

    HTTPS

    In 2016, we've experienced a big increase in the HTTPS adoption by many websites .And this become a must-have for every website developer because user privacy is mandatory nowadays. Mozilla and many other big companies have sponsored a project called let's encrypt which offers free TLS certificates for everyone.Recently, Mozilla announced that more than 50% of web pages visited by Firefox users were secured by HTTPS . This is a very important step toward a secure web .I expect that 2017 will be the year of HTTPS and I hope that more and more websites will be secured with HTTPS.

    Encrypted chat Apps

    Whatsapp , the 1 Billion users chat App announced that it can't access the content of the messages sent by its users because they are end-to-end encrypted. Same for Viber , Telegram (secret chat) , and Signal . The Snowden-approved chat App Signal , announced that it has an increase in its App download especially after the US election. Using one of these Apps , you can privately connect to your friends and family without being watched by big companies , governments and hackers. I expect that 2017 will be the year in which we can connect securely to our friends.

    Virtual Reality

    In 2016 , Mark Zuckerberg showed us an amazing demo for Facebook plan for the VR (Virtual Reality). Google also announced that Youtube is able to deliver a live 360° video , so you can attend an event 1000 miles away without leaving your home !

    With many projects like Aframe (a Mozilla library for creating VR scene using HTML) , I expect that in 2017 we can visit many countries , attend Mozilla , Google , Apple events without leaving home , playing games in VR scenes ...

    Artificial Intelligence

    Lately in 2016 , we heard a lot about IA assistants like Google Assistant and Jarvis which is an AI assistant announced by Mark Zuckerberg. In 2017, I expect that AI will be integrated in most of 2017's products and help us make things done.

    2017 wishes

    I wish that Firefox , will get more market share because , honestly, it deserves to be the first browser in the world. In this moment , Mozilla is working on many privacy features for Firefox in its Nightly version (Alpha version) as well as integrating Rust into its browser, this will make it way faster.

    Let's work hard to make our future better and let's put one foot in front of another everyday !

    After participating in the last year edition of SFD (Software Freedom Day), this year I participated as a speaker from Mozilla Tunisia community. In this blog post I'll talk about my experience and all the important things happened there.

    I started my journey too early ,4:30 am, to prepare myself and to get early to the bus. I traveled with different communities ISETchux , Esprit Libre and of course Mozilla Tunisia.

    In this SFD edition, Mozilla Tunisia had 3 talks :

    • Mine about "IoT and open source"
    • Amine Zaafouri about "Personal leadership"
    • Bechir Nemlaghi about "Rust", the new programming language by Mozilla
    • Manel Rhaiem about "Gender equality"

    [caption id="attachment_2069" align="aligncenter" width="430"] SFD 2016 schedule[/caption]

    I gave facts about that, I gave numbers from the HP report.The solution for this problems is OPEN SOURCE ! I explained how Open Source could helps us solve IoT issues and what are the tools , platforms and products that are ready in 2016.

He was always smiling during my conference and since he was at the front of the conference room, he helped me to handle the stress.After the presentation he asked me a great question,he focused on a real problem that frustrated many startups in Tunisia.     His session was very interactive, we did many experiments and the results was surprising. One of them is a memory test.He shows us an image for 5 seconds, two persons from different personalities remembered different things for this same image.

    The wisdom behind it: We are different , with this difference we build a better team!

    Amine's conference is one of the best ones at the SFD.

    Bechir gave a presentation about Rust, the new programming language built by Mozilla community and Manel about the gender equality.She mentioned how in our community we have a 50/50 men and women.

    Unfortunately, I wasn't able to attend Bechir and Manel presentations because I had to be at the Mozilla booth to answer the different questions about Mozilla projects.I felt very excited and happy when I talk and introduce Mozilla to people, specially when I convince someone to use Firefox or when someone say "Aframe is really awesome ! I want to learn more about VR".

    We offered the opportunity for people to try Virtual Reality using our headsets, it was very funny 😅

    One of the best things at SFD is to meet your old and new friends from different communities, from different regions, from different backgrounds to talk about what we've done last year and what we're planning for.

    Finally, the shows began and Rached Alaya announced who will win the prices of best community, best speaker and best workshop. Anis el Acheche and Naeil Zoueidi and Mrs Hela Boucetta won this prices. Congrats ! 🎉 🎉 🎉

    As usually, SFD was an opportunity to be inspired by great people. I wish to see more communities and other great projects next year ! Unleash your potential !

  • Smartphones ≥ Ordinateurs

    On a commencé le mois de Novembre avec des nouvelles !

    Statcounter , un site web spécialisé dans les statistiques des navigateurs et systèmes d'exploitations , a annoncé que l'usage des terminaux mobiles , smartphone et tablette , a dépassé pour la première fois l'usage des ordinateurs . Quelle est l'importance de cette information ? Que va-t-elle changer dans l'avenir ?

     

    Pourquoi ce changement ?

    L'image ci-dessus , nous illustre l'augmentation de l'usage des terminaux mobiles depuis 2009 jusqu’à 2016 . En 7 ans , le marché est inversé !

    Pour plusieurs internautes le smartphone est devenu un besoin vitale , il est désormais leur nouveau ordinateur portable à cause de son prix réduit (par rapport aux ordinateurs), sa taille , et surtout pour la connectivité à Internet : tous ces facteurs ont contribué a cette révolution qui va , certes , changer beaucoup de choses .

    Qu'est-ce qui va changé ?

    Cette information est trop importante pour les développeurs pour qu'ils adaptent leurs produits pour les mobiles . A partir de maintenant , il faut que tous les développeurs web changent leurs sites web vers des sites "Responsive" , c'est à dire qui s'adaptent a tous les tailles des écrans , donc ils facilitent plus la navigation depuis les smartphones.

    Pour les sociétés , avoir une application mobile est devenu primordiale pour atterrir le maximum de clients , puisque 51% des internautes utilisent le mobile .

     

    La révolution des mobiles a commencé depuis des années , et aujourd'hui ils ont dominé le marché de l'Internet . A l'aube de 2020 , les experts prévoient une autre révolution mais cette fois-ci une révolution de l'IoT (Internet des objets). Comment sera notre vie dans 4 ans ? Et comment on peut assurer l'infrastructure pour ces milliards d'objets connectés ?
